intro: Lespedeza cyrtobotrya, commonly known as Chinese stragglerbush, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Lespedeza cyrtobotrya is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its small, pink or purple flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
